intro: Nissolia brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a small evergreen tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its glossy green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a sweet, juicy pulp. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Nissolia brasiliensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit.
